bibl.title: Filiation the Egyptian Way in Greek Documents.
bibl.note: 1. Early Ptolemaic period. - 2. Roman period. - 3. Coptic period. - In Greek filiation is usually indicated by the genitive of the father's name, in Demotic the father's name is introduced by a hieroglyphic sign which we read as s3 ""son of"", but was pronounced in fact as pa- ""the one of"". This Egyptian filiation is rendered as πα in a few early Ptolemaic Greek ostraca and Roman period mummy labels. A possible survivor in Coptic is rather doubtful. - Avec résumé en anglais.
